  • Edit
    AddCollectionWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, IList<TaskAddParameter>, TaskAddCollectionOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    AddCollectionWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, IList(Of TaskAddParameter), TaskAddCollectionOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Adds a collection of tasks to the specified job.

    Task<AzureOperationResponse<TaskAddCollectionResult, TaskAddCollectionHeaders>> AddCollectionWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, IList<TaskAddParameter> value, TaskAddCollectionOptions taskAddCollectionOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function AddCollectionWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, value As IList(Of TaskAddParameter), taskAddCollectionOptions As TaskAddCollectionOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of AzureOperationResponse(Of TaskAddCollectionResult, TaskAddCollectionHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job to which the task collection is to be added.

    • value
      IList<TaskAddParameter>
      IList(Of TaskAddParameter)

      The collection of tasks to add.

    • taskAddCollectionOptions
      TaskAddCollectionOptions
      TaskAddCollectionOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse<TaskAddCollectionResult, TaskAddCollectionHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse(Of TaskAddCollectionResult, TaskAddCollectionHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    • Microsoft.Rest.SerializationException
      Microsoft.Rest.SerializationException

      Thrown when unable to deserialize the response

    • Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException
      Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException

      Thrown when a required parameter is null

    Remarks

    Note that each task must have a unique ID. The Batch service may not return the results for each task in the same order the tasks were submitted in this request. If the server times out or the connection is closed during the request, the request may have been partially or fully processed, or not at all. In such cases, the user should re-issue the request. Note that it is up to the user to correctly handle failures when re-issuing a request. For example, you should use the same task ids during a retry so that if the prior operation succeeded, the retry will not create extra tasks unexpectedly.

    DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, TaskDeleteOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, TaskDeleteOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Deletes a task from the specified job.

    Task<AzureOperationHeaderResponse<TaskDeleteHeaders>> DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, string taskId, TaskDeleteOptions taskDeleteOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, taskId As String, taskDeleteOptions As TaskDeleteOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of TaskDeleteHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job from which to delete the task.

    • taskId
      String
      String

      The ID of the task to delete.

    • taskDeleteOptions
      TaskDeleteOptions
      TaskDeleteOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<TaskDeleteHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of TaskDeleteHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    • Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException
      Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException

      Thrown when a required parameter is null

    Remarks

    When a task is deleted, all of the files in its directory on the compute node where it ran are also deleted (regardless of the retention time). For multi-instance tasks, the delete task operation applies synchronously to the primary task; subtasks and their files are then deleted asynchronously in the background.

    ReactivateWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, TaskReactivateOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    ReactivateWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, TaskReactivateOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Reactivates the specified task.

    Task<AzureOperationHeaderResponse<TaskReactivateHeaders>> ReactivateWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, string taskId, TaskReactivateOptions taskReactivateOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function ReactivateWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, taskId As String, taskReactivateOptions As TaskReactivateOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of TaskReactivateHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job containing the task.

    • taskId
      String
      String

      The ID of the task to reactivate.

    • taskReactivateOptions
      TaskReactivateOptions
      TaskReactivateOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<TaskReactivateHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of TaskReactivateHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    • Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException
      Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException

      Thrown when a required parameter is null

    Remarks

    Reactivation makes a task eligible to be retried again up to its maximum retry count. The task's state is changed to active. As the task is no longer in the completed state, any previous exit code or scheduling error is no longer available after reactivation. This will fail for tasks that are not completed or that previously completed successfully (with an exit code of 0). Additionally, this will fail if the job has completed (or is terminating or deleting).

      BatchErrorException

    • Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException
      Microsoft.Rest.ValidationException

      Thrown when a required parameter is null

    Remarks

    When the task has been terminated, it moves to the completed state. For multi-instance tasks, the terminate task operation applies synchronously to the primary task; subtasks are then terminated asynchronously in the background.
